intro: Clidemia macropora, commonly known as the broadleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that bloom in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant has opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy and have a glandular surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia macropora is also known for its ability to spread through vegetative means, making it both a common and sometimes invasive species in its native habitats.
